Happened to walk by just as they were opening, as we were on our way to find a new tapas place to go to after learning that Cal Pep was closed for the holidays.  There was already a line of about six people out the door just before they opened, which is always a good sign.  I had recognized the name from a list of best tapas, and I am so glad we came here.  We got a seat at a table, and the restaurant filled up within 20 minutes.  People were standing in corners waiting for a table as we were getting our first course.  They do not have an English menu but are happy to explain the menu.  What we got:Anchovies Octopus in a green oil based sauceTuna belly with what seemed like white asparagus but not sureJamon IbericoThe food comes with a side of the ubiquitous bread that's spread with tomato and garlic, which they refill as needed.Everything was absolutely delicious!  Loved the busy atmosphere and dining with locals and tourists alike.
